title: Why do I never cry at anything? - Quora

response.answer_text: If this is common for you, you may have an unusual type of depression. I do. I would cry and think, “Susan, why are you crying about this?! It’s not that big a deal!” But it was like there was a tap somewhere that I couldn’t find, so I couldn’t turn it off. My clinical depression was missed for more 40 years because it didn’t look like clinical depression usually does. I wasn’t sad, I showed no obvious signs of depression. It took not just a psychiatrist to diagnose it, but one specializing in depression. I went on meds and my life changed within a couple of days. If this was just a one-time thing, it would be because we are first feeling beings. If you have not allowed a feeling to surface, if you have been pushing it down, it will come out in ways you do not expect or recognize. If it’s none of those, then I don’t know.
